title: Get rid of true damage so that builds actually matter.
body: I shouldn't be dying to a Yasuo in under 1 second when I build four fucking armor items because he does 17 million true damage and just negates my entire build. It's actually fucking stupid and makes the game pointless.

replies.body: It's only just Yasuo because this {{item:3031}} and Guardian.

And **Guardian**? The rune that gives you and an ally a temporary shield and MS boost when your ally takes damage when you're either right next to them or recently cast a spell on them? The one that Yasuo has no reason to ever take, because there's so many *better* runes Yasuo could take in literally any other instance? The one that only *technically* gives damage and only because Celerity and Ardent exist, and gives no damage by itself? That Guardian?
on a side note guardian doesn't just proc when an ally gets hit but also if the caster of guardian gets hit that's why i no longer self cast w on taric in a team fight anymore

Wait, it also works on the caster being hit?

That makes sense, I suppose. Wasn't sure if it did, though, so left it ambiguously out so that I couldn't be called wrong. XD
i also learnt the hard way self casting taric w isn't a targeted shield

True damage is fine.

%maxHP True damage is not fine.

- Me, An Intellectual Tank player

::::::Also on a side note:::::::

5000 armor. 20hp. dies in 1 auto.

5000 hp. 20 armor. Dies in 20 autos.

Something here is more important than the other.
I think the Sources of true damage need to be limited for sure.

Yasuo is designed to eat tanks late game. Thats the intended function of Crit. 
But I do at least believe that Yasuo's passive and his ult's buff are redundant with {{item:3031}} . 
He doesn't need double crit, Infinity Edge already does that. 
He doesn't need 50% armor pen, Infinity Edge + Conqueror does enough

Yasuo would probably do that without the true damage. His ult passive makes his crits ignore 50% of your bonus armor (which is from items, runes, and buffs), and his builds tend to have items that melt tanks rather quickly anyway.
